my technical opinion/suggestions:

## Use Mergers

i think sub reddit style, but decentralized, each sub has it's own owners which is a merger site
thus "reddit" maintainer dont have responsibilities nor can censor anything (wish milchan is like this, while the owner dont really care it's still would be better IMO)
there will be a central protocol committee and a centrally maintained client(like zerome, but anyone can make their own client+hub)
each merger site can contain one or more then one "sub"(so you dont need 1 site for each sub)
owner can make sub creations public/owner only
thus it allows you to view ALL collected threads in ONE place from subs you subscribed(subscribe is like a button that tells the client to render it in homepage) or tuned in(tuned in is like a local /r/all, all merger zones will be listed)

## Hybrid Comment Section

for comments, i see a clash, some people like a liner/flat conversation(like here/mail/forums) or nested/hierarchical(like reddit)
i feel like we can hybrid them
basically all threads start with liner replies, all liner replies can be replied linearly or nested,
all nested comments must start with a liner reply
nest can go to infinite depth
Example:
```
[reply1]
{
 [nested liner reply1]
 {
  [nested reply to nested liner reply1]
  [second nested reply to nested liner reply1]
 }
 [liner reply2]
}
[reply2]
[reply3]
```
while i originally planned out that all threads can be replied nested or linearly same for all nested
but i have trouble warp my head around how that would work
and over complicated is bad because it make it harder for people to understand or use

## Comment/Thread Sorting

for sorting, i personally feel like it should be default sort by new, sorting by hot/top is asking for a disaster to happen as anyone can simply vote fraud
and no one done it yet is just because we all abide by the unspoken gentleman's rules
of course you could change it to hot/top for your amusement but said values shouldnt be directly trusted

for comments order it would be sort by new, or can be made to sort my activity which will show nested replies in timeline scale for discovery

## Indexing Problem With Mergers

the problem with mergers is like the problem with torrent, yes a torrent is hard to take down, but a tracker can be easily take down
to translate to this context, all these sub[reddit]mergers need to be listed somehow
but the listing can easily be controlled, like torrent trackers which is bad for our cause
i dont have any solutions other than to support multiple listings
officially we can have two listings, submerger listing and [uncensored]submerger listing
submerger listing will have mild moderation
uncensored listing will have 0 moderation(but we have no way to enforce or proof we have 0 moderation power other then trust)
and then 3rd party listings, which is a collection of other people listing which we intentionally have 0 control over
sadly the only way would be embedding such data into our client

## Cross Linking

we also have problem on how to cross link to sub[reddit]page on same submerger or different mergers
i think we should always assume a subpage always has a Unique Generated Identifier which is random, and consist of AUTHADDRESS/randomoruserinputdata

and only site owner is capable of creating a subpage with a readable identifier(SITE/ID) by creating the subpage at address data root or to alias file linking to AUTHADDRESS/randomuserinputdata since if the data isnt unique everything will go in wreck

everything should be able to be linked by submerger(address/.bit)/subpage(which can be readable/authaddress+userinputdata)

## User Profile

for user profile since everyone is now everywhere on each submerger user could customize/create their own profile data which dont have to be identical cross mergers
user can also query user data by searching using authaddress to find all user's data cross mergers they are in

## User name problem

this also need to somehow natively support all singers and always assume username to NOT be unique
i think we should display it as Thunder33345(AHEQ...MX5K)@zeroid.bit(iD5Z...duGz)
the () are the first and last 4 characters of the public key
both user and signer trucend key can be toggled, how much first and last char/all char or hidden/mouseover
this prevent impersonations on signers that allow same usernames(afaik public key will always be unique)
